paper_abstract: In this paper we aim to study the separation problem for the second order elliptic differential expression of the form E = Delta(M) + b(i) partial derivative(2)/(partial derivative x)i(2) + q, with the real-valued positive continuous functions b(i), on a complete Riemannian manifold (M, g) with metric g, where Delta(M) is the scalar Laplacian on M and q >= 0 is a locally square integrable function on M. In the terminology of Everitt and Giertz, E is said to be separated in L-2 (M) if for u is an element of L-2 (M) such that Eu is an element of L-2 (M), we have bi partial derivative(2)u/(partial derivative x)i(2) and qu is an element of L-2 (M). We give sufficient conditions for E to be separated in L-2 (M).
paper_title: Separation Problem for Second Order Elliptic Differential Operators on Riemannian Manifolds
